title: Interpolation for tag names or tagName pseudo-attribute
body:
It would be cool if Jade supported the interpolation for tag names (or any other way to customize the tag names).

This can be helpful when you need a mixin with a lot of content, but you'll need to change its tag name in some conditions. Like if you have

``` Jade
mixin item(icon)
  li.list-item
    if attributes.href
      a(attributes)
        img.icon(src = icon + ".png")
        span.inner
          block
    else
      span(attributes)
        img.icon(src = icon + ".png")
        span.inner
          block

+item("about") About us
+item("portfolio")(href="/portfolio/") Portfolio
+item("contacts")(href="/contacts/") Contact us
```

Right now, as you see, you need to completely duplicate the code in the tags for different tags. Of course, you could do something like that:

``` Jade
mixin item(icon)
  mixin item-contents
    img.icon(src = icon + ".png")
    span.inner
      block
  li.list-item
    if attributes.href
      a(attributes)
        +item-contents
    else
      span(attributes)
        +item-contents
```

But it's still ugly and if you'd have some extra different tags available (`strong` for current item, etc.), it would be ugly.

So, something like that would be much better:

``` Jade
mixin item(icon)
  li.list-item
    tag = 'span'
    if attributes.href
      tag = 'a'

    #{tag}(attributes)
      img.icon(src = icon + ".png")
      span.inner
        block
```

Another way, is to create pseudo-attribute like `tagName`, so if you'd set it, the tag's name would change. That would be even prettier:

``` Jade

mixin item(icon)
  li.list-item
    span(attributes, tagName = attributes.href ? 'a' : undefined)
      img.icon(src = icon + ".png")
      span.inner
        block
```
